content.question: The position of an object is described by <math alttext="x of t equals, A times t squared, minus B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo> </mo><mo>=</mo><mo> </mo><mi>A</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mi>B</mi></math> and <math alttext="y of t equals, B minus, C times t cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo> </mo><mo>=</mo><mo> </mo><mi>B</mi><mo> </mo><mo>-</mo><mo> </mo><mi>C</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math>, where <math alttext="A equals, 3 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext> m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, <math alttext="B equals 2 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext> m</mtext></math>, <math alttext="C equals 1 meter per second cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext> m/s</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></math>, and <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is in seconds. The magnitude of the objectâ€™s acceleration at <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and at <math alttext="t equals 1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> are <math alttext="a sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, respectively. Which of the following claims about <math alttext="a sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is true?

choices.label: <math alttext="a sub 0 equals a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="a sub 0 is greater than a sub 1, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>
<math alttext="0 equals, a sub 0 is less than a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="0 is less than a sub 0, which is less than a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="0 is less than a sub 0, which is less than a sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

topic.text: 1.5: Motion in Two or Three Dimensions

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
